premise_source_doc_sentence: Judd Apatow  (  -LSB- ˈæpətaʊ -RSB- born December 6 , 1967  )  is an American film producer , writer , director , actor , and comedian .

He is best known as a musician for his song `` Heart of Mine '' in the movie Keeping the Faith , his song score for the 2006 film Down in the Valley , and for co-writing the Dracula puppet musical finale , `` A Taste for Love '' , in the Judd Apatow produced film , Forgetting Sarah Marshall .

Brent White is an American film editor with credits on feature films dating from 1993 and White has worked on comedy films produced or co-produced by Judd Apatow , and directed by Apatow or Adam McKay .
The 40-Year-Old Virgin is a 2005 American sex comedy film written , produced and directed by Judd Apatow , about a middle-aged man 's journey to finally have sex .
Bridesmaids is a 2011 American comedy film directed by Paul Feig , written by Annie Mumolo and Kristen Wiig , and produced by Judd Apatow , Barry Mendel and Clayton Townsend .
